## Description {#details}

This file contains the IR transform to lower external or indirect calls for the ARM64EC calling convention.

Such calls must go through the runtime, so we can translate the calling convention for calls into the emulator.

This subsumes Control Flow Guard handling.

<SectionDefinition>

<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The first argument to a thunk is the called function, stored in x9.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For exit thunks, we pass the called function down to the emulator;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// for entry/guest exit thunks, we just call the Arm64 function directly.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (TT == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/coff/#ae7629a0652411dc2be61aea4fee2b39cacd4cef2a5a26efd5d75ecca95bc6ff24">Arm64ECThunkType::Exit</a>)</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> AArch64Arm64ECCallLowering::getThunkArgTypes(</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/functiontype">FunctionType</a> &#42;FT, AttributeList AttrList, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/coff/#ae7629a0652411dc2be61aea4fee2b39c">Arm64ECThunkType</a> TT,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> &amp;Out, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;Type &#42;&gt;</a> &amp;Arm64ArgTypes,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;Type &#42;&gt;</a> &amp;X64ArgTypes,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;ThunkArgTranslation&gt;</a> &amp;ArgTranslations, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> HasSretPtr) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><Highlight kind="normal">  Out &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;$&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (FT-&gt;isVarArg()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We treat the variadic function&#39;s thunk as a normal function</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// with the following type on the ARM side:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   rettype exitthunk(</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     ptr x9, ptr x0, i64 x1, i64 x2, i64 x3, ptr x4, i64 x5)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// that can coverage all types of variadic function.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// x9 is similar to normal exit thunk, store the called function.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// x0-x3 is the arguments be stored in registers.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// x4 is the address of the arguments on the stack.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// x5 is the size of the arguments on the stack.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// On the x64 side, it&#39;s the same except that x5 isn&#39;t set.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If both the ARM and X64 sides are sret, there are only three</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="171"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// arguments in registers.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If the X64 side is sret, but the ARM side isn&#39;t, we pass an extra value</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to/from the X64 side, and let SelectionDAG transform it into a memory</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// location.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176"><Highlight kind="normal">    Out &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;varargs&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// x0-x3</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="179"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> i = HasSretPtr ? 1 : 0; i &lt; 4; i++) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180"><Highlight kind="normal">      Arm64ArgTypes.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectortemplatebase/#af42bfbc067df27c19ee2fc859df58799">push&#95;back</a>(I64Ty);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// sret+inreg indicates a call that returns a C++ class value. This is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// actually equivalent to just passing and returning a void&#42; pointer</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// trying to model &quot;inreg&quot; in the thunk&#39;s calling convention; this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00280" /><CodeLine lineNumber="280"><Highlight kind="normal">        ArgTranslations.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectortemplatebase/#af42bfbc067df27c19ee2fc859df58799">push&#95;back</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-aarch64arm64eccalllowering-cpp-/#a90d5de758d7bbed5750d7f8756efd59ea2ae40416f6380618d5b202ac553d6bdc">ThunkArgTranslation::Direct</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00595" /><CodeLine lineNumber="595"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Return to the caller.  Note that the isel has code to translate this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00596" /><CodeLine lineNumber="596"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &quot;ret&quot; to a tail call to &#95;&#95;os&#95;arm64x&#95;dispatch&#95;ret.  (Alternatively, we</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00597" /><CodeLine lineNumber="597"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// could emit a tail call here, but that would require a dedicated calling</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00598" /><CodeLine lineNumber="598"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// convention, which seems more complicated overall.)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00599" /><CodeLine lineNumber="599"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (X64RetType-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type/#ae8eaa0b4eeac52a2b2282cb1bfd981ae">isVoidTy</a>())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00600" /><CodeLine lineNumber="600"><Highlight kind="normal">    IRB.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irbuilderbase/#aa6536556982b7e6e2e5884e471f3ce6b">CreateRetVoid</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00601" /><CodeLine lineNumber="601"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
